CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1953, page 4, reads: "Carver Day Luncheon . . . Held in the ballroom of the Sheraton Hotel, was jammed with three or four hundred guests who came to hear Dr. Merze Tate, professor of history at Howard University, speak on "Challenges of Our Age." A portion of the crowd can be seen here. The event was sponsored by the National Achievement Clubs, Inc., Mrs. Alma A. Illery, founder-president. - Teenie Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men, including man far left in foreground, wearing eyeglasses, light colored shirt, and dark jacket, seated at banquet table with food, in interior the ballroom of the Penn Sheraton Hotel for the Carver Day Luncheon, another version
